alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 9:41AM PST until January 12 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...BLIZZARD WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...The blizzard warning has expired. Heavy snow possible late tonight through Thursday. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Holden Village, and Stehekin. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the travel through Friday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
